Description: Cornelian bead; flattened spherical shape; perforated for suspension.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hala Sultan Tekke, Tomb VIII
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg 1986, 'Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus', in V. Karageorghis (ed.), Cyprus between the Orient and the Occident, Nicosia, 163-4 for a discussion of carnelian on Cyprus during the LBA. The material was probably imported from Egypt; many of the closely dateable examples come from LCIIC-IIIA contexts, which may reflect an influx of Egyptian objects and raw materials to the island at this time.
Bibliographic references: Bailey 1976 / Hala Sultan Tekke I. Excavations 1897-1971 (p. 16, pl. XVIm)
